5996.quoteText: you may not access or use the PARSEC PROPERTIES if you are not at least 18 years old or the age of majority in the jurisdiction from which you are accessing the PARSEC PROPERTIES (or are at least 13 years old and have your parent or legal guardian’s consent).
5996.title: This service is only available to users of a certain age

5997.quoteText:
We use the following types of cookies:
  1. Essential Cookies - These cookies are essential to provide you with the Services and to enable you to use some of its features. For example, they allow you to log in to secure areas of the Services and help the content of the pages you request load quickly.
5997.title: This service requires first-party cookies, which are cookies that only belong to the domain of the service and not a third party.

tosdr.case: This service requires first-party cookies, which are cookies that only belong to the domain of the service and not a third party.

5998.quoteText: Without these cookies, the Services that you have asked for cannot be provided.
5998.title: Blocking cookies may limit your ability to use the service

tosdr.case: Blocking cookies may limit your ability to use the service

5999.quoteText: In addition to the tracking technologies we place, other companies may set their own cookies or similar tools when you use the Services. This includes third party analytics services, including but not limited to Google Analytics (“Analytics Services”), that we engage to help analyze how users use the Services.
5999.title: This service uses third-party cookies for statistics

tosdr.case: This service uses third-party cookies for statistics

6000.quoteText: In addition, we use “pixel tags” (also referred to as clear GIFs, Web beacons, or Web bugs). Pixel tags are tiny graphic images with a unique identifier, similar in function to cookies, which are used to track online movements of Web users.
6000.title: The service may use tracking pixels, web beacons, browser fingerprinting, and/or device fingerprinting on users.

tosdr.case: The service may use tracking pixels, web beacons, browser fingerprinting, and/or device fingerprinting on users.

6001.quoteText:
Some Internet browsers may be configured to send "Do Not Track" signals to the online services that you visit.
We currently do not respond to do not track signals.
6001.title: This service ignores the Do Not Track (DNT) header and tracks users anyway even if they set this header.

tosdr.case: This service ignores the Do Not Track (DNT) header and tracks users anyway even if they set this header.

6002.quoteText:
We may share some or all of your Personal Data in connection with or during negotiation of any merger, financing, acquisition or dissolution transaction or proceeding involving sale, transfer, divestiture, or disclosure of all or a portion of our business or assets.
In the event of an insolvency, bankruptcy, or receivership, Personal Data may also be transferred as a business asset.
6002.title: The service can sell or otherwise transfer your personal data as part of a bankruptcy proceeding or other type of financial transaction.

tosdr.case: The service can sell or otherwise transfer your personal data as part of a bankruptcy proceeding or other type of financial transaction.

6003.quoteText: All users may review, update, correct or delete the Personal Data in their user account (including any imported contacts) by contacting us or editing their profile via the Service.
6003.title: You can request access and deletion of personal data

tosdr.case: You can request access and deletion of personal data
